intro: Wisteria floribunda var. alba, commonly known as the Japanese wisteria, is a deciduous climbing plant native to East Asia. It is characterized by its long, flexible stems that can reach lengths of up to 30 meters, allowing it to climb trees or structures. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white flowers in early spring, which are followed by long, bean-like pods containing seeds. Its leaves are compound, consisting of 10–20 pairs of oval, serrated leaflets. The plant thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
